original: blo gros chen po de la mtshan nyid kyi ngag ni rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs la mngon par zhen pa las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: blo gros chen po de la mtshan nyid kyi ngag ni rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs la mngon par zhen pa las 'byung ngo //

analyzed: blo gros chen po rmi lam gyi ngag ni sngon myong ba'i yul rjes su dran pa dang rtog pa'i yul med pa las 'byung ngo //
translated: MahƒÅmati, the speech of dreams arises from the recollection of previously experienced objects and the nonexistence of conceptual objects.

original: blo gros chen po gnas ngan len gyi rnam par rtog pa'i ngag ni sngon byas pa'i las rjes su dran pa las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: blo gros chen po gnas ngan len gyi rnam par rtog pa'i ngag ni sngon byas pa'i las rjes su dran pa las 'byung ngo //
translated: MahƒÅmati, the speech of negative tendencies arises from the recollection of previously performed actions.

original: blo gros chen po thog ma med pa'i dus kyi rnam par rtog pa'i dag ni thog ma med pa'i dus kyi spros pa la mngon par zhes pa'i gnas ngan gyi rang gi sa bon las 'byung ste /

translated: MahƒÅmati, the speech of beginningless time arises from the seeds of one‚Äôs own negative tendencies, which are the attachment to the elaborations of beginningless time.

original: ngag bzhi @224b po'i mtshan nyid spyod pa bsdus pa'i sgron ma las gsungs so //
analyzed: ngag bzhi @224b po'i mtshan nyid spyod pa bsdus pa'i sgron ma las gsungs so //
translated: The characteristics of these four types of speech are taught in the Lamp That Summarizes the Practice.

original: ngag bzhi po de rnams kyang dang po gnyis ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa las 'byung ba dang / phyi ma gnyis po ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las 'byung bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ngag bzhi po de rnams kyang dang po gnyis ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa las 'byung ba dang / phyi ma gnyis po ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las 'byung bar shes par bya'o //
translated: And it should be understood that the first two of these four statements occur in the evolving consciousnesses, while the latter two occur in the afflicted mind and the store consciousness.

original: ye shes gsum gyi dbye ba yis //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ye shes gsum gyi dbye ba yis // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

original: de ltar ye shes gsum gyi dbye bas 'di nyid sems tsam la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar ye shes gsum gyi dbye bas 'di nyid sems tsam la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the conventional is the knowledge of the conventional, which is the knowledge of the mind only.üîΩThe knowledge of discrimination is the knowledge of discrimination, which is the knowledge of the wind.

original: dper na rlung dang sngags kyi de kho na nyid gang yin pa de nyid rlung la zhon pa'i rnam par shes pa yin te /
analyzed: dper na rlung dang sngags kyi de kho na nyid gang yin pa de nyid rlung la zhon pa'i rnam par shes pa yin te /

original: gang gi phyir rlung gi shing rta la zhon pa rnam par shes pas 'gro ba skyed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rlung gi shing rta la zhon pa rnam par shes pas 'gro ba skyed par byed pa yin no //

original: rim pa 'dis ngag rnam par sbyang ba ste /üîΩrim pa gnyis pas snang ba rgyur gyur ba'i rang bzhin phra mo sbyang bar bya ste /
analyzed: rim pa 'dis ngag rnam par sbyang ba ste / rim pa gnyis pas snang ba rgyur gyur ba'i rang bzhin phra mo sbyang bar bya ste /
translated: The knowledge of suchness is the knowledge of the mantra, because it is the knowledge of the mantra that is suchness.üîΩThe knowledge of the conventional is the knowledge of the mind only, because it is the knowledge of the mind only that is the conventional.

original: khyad par bstan to //
analyzed: khyad par bstan to //
translated: The knowledge of discrimination is the knowledge of the wind, because it is the knowledge of the wind that is the discrimination.üîΩThe knowledge of suchness is the knowledge of the mantra, because it is the knowledge of the mantra that is suchness.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa slob ma gang la sbyin pa dang / sbyin par bya ba ma yin pa de brtag par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa slob ma gang la sbyin pa dang / sbyin par bya ba ma yin pa de brtag par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to examine the disciple to whom the stage of vajra repetition should be given, and who should not be given,üîΩ[the BhagavƒÅn] declares,

original: bla ma la brnyas sgyu can dad par med //
analyzed: bla ma la brnyas sgyu can dad par med //
translated: Disrespectful, deceitful, and faithless,

original: sngags kyis rlom zhing glegs bam mthong bas khengs //
analyzed: sngags kyis rlom zhing glegs bam mthong bas khengs //

original: dad pa med cing dbang bskur dman ba la //
analyzed: dad pa med cing dbang bskur dman ba la //

analyzed: gtam gyi rim pa 'ang de la brjod mi bya // zhes bya ba gsungs te /

original: de ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji lta bu yin zhe na /

original: dbang bskur dman pa ni rig pa'i dbang bskur ba tsam thob pa ste /
analyzed: dbang bskur dman pa ni rig pa'i dbang bskur ba tsam thob pa ste /

analyzed: bla na med pa'i dbang bskur ba ma thob pa gang yin pa de la rim pa 'di bstan par mi bya ste snod ma yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: snod kyi mtshan nyid bshad par bya ba'i phyir / gang zhig bla ma la gus dad dang ldan //

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /

analyzed: rin po che lta bu'i gang zag gang yin pa de la bla mas bka' drin sbyin par bya ba la brtag par bya ba ma yin te /

original: rim pa'i don @225a * //
analyzed: rim pa'i don @225a * //

analyzed: ji lta bu yin zhe na /

original: dad pa dang ldan pa ni bden pa dang dkon mchog gsum la sogs pa la snying dga' ba dang / de bzhin du bla ma la gus pa ni rdo rje slob dpon gyi bkur sti la chags pa dang / de bzhin du thos pa 'dzin pa ni lan gcig tu bshad pa'i chos brjed ngas pa med pas ji srid 'tsho'i bar du 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa dang ldan pa ni bden pa dang dkon mchog gsum la sogs pa la snying dga' ba dang / de bzhin du bla ma la gus pa ni rdo rje slob dpon gyi bkur sti la chags pa dang / de bzhin du thos pa 'dzin pa ni lan gcig tu bshad pa'i chos brjed ngas pa med pas ji srid 'tsho'i bar du 'dzin pa'o //

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /

analyzed: tshul khrims dag cing mkhas la drang //

analyzed: bla ma'i drin gyis phan pa'i lung thob nas //

analyzed: grel  bar mi 'gyur snyam yang grol bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba gsungs te /

analyzed: ma nges pa ni 'dod chags dang mya ngan la sogs pas mnan pa'i gang zag la yang ba spu ldang ba la sogs pa mthong bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: bstan pa'i sgo nas kyang de nyid mtshon par mi nus te de ni rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: rnam par mi rtog par dang // rnam par rtog pa dag phan tshun 'gal bas rnam par mi rtog par ston na yang de nyid rtog pa dang bcas par thal par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog par dang // rnam par rtog pa dag phan tshun 'gal bas rnam par mi rtog par ston na yang de nyid rtog pa dang bcas par thal par 'gyur te /

original: khyab par byed pa nyid nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa nyid nyams pa'i phyir ro //

original: gang gi phyir de kho na nyid ni phyogs gcig tu gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de kho na nyid ni phyogs gcig tu gnas pa yin te /

analyzed: rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i dngos po khyab par phyir ro //

original: gal te de yod pa yin na bsgom pas dgos pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gal te de yod pa yin na bsgom pas dgos pa med pa'o //

original: med na ni bsgom pas kyang bya ba med do //
analyzed: med na ni bsgom pas kyang bya ba med do //

original: gal te cha gnyis nye bar bsdus na 'gal ba'i chos 'byung bas /
analyzed: gal te cha gnyis nye bar bsdus na 'gal ba'i chos 'byung bas /
translated: If it is a combination of the two, then contradictory properties would arise.

original: de ni bsgom par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni bsgom par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to meditate on it.

original: @225b de bas na bla ma'i bka' drin ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: @225b de bas na bla ma'i bka' drin ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: How then is there the kindness of the guru?üîΩIt is said:

analyzed: smras pa / sngags kyi theg pa che po 'di dpal byang chub rdo rjes phyag rgya bzhi bstan pa yin te /
translated: This great vehicle of mantra is the teaching of the four seals of glorious Vajradhara.

analyzed: de la phyag rgya gsum ni thabs dang / tha ma bzhi pa gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu'o //

analyzed: de la re zhig las kyi phyag rgya la sogs pa'i nang nas gang yang rung ba slob ma la gtad pa de la /
translated: Among them, the disciple is entrusted with any one of the action seal and so on.

analyzed: de yis de dang lhan cig tu snang ba la sogs pa nyams su myong nas 'od gsal ba mngon du byas shing /
translated: Through that, he experiences the appearance and so on, and he realizes the clear light.

original: dpe dang dpe las 'byung ba dag chos can dang chos nyid kyi rigs pas chos sku 'di kho na yin no zhes shes nas rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings la bzhugs te /

translated: Having understood that this very dharmakƒÅya is the example and the one arising from the example through the reasoning of the nature of phenomena and the phenomena possessing that nature, one abides in the nonconceptual dhƒÅtu.

original: de las langs nas slar yang ye shes la rtsol ba dang ldan pas bskal ba stong gi bar du gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: de las langs nas slar yang ye shes la rtsol ba dang ldan pas bskal ba stong gi bar du gnas par bya'o //
translated: Having arisen from that, one should abide for a thousand eons with the exertion of wisdom.

original: ldang ba'i dus su slob dpon gyis bstan pa'i sgo nas de kho na nyid gsal bar bya ba'i don du rjes su smra ba yin te /
analyzed: ldang ba'i dus su slob dpon gyis bstan pa'i sgo nas de kho na nyid gsal bar bya ba'i don du rjes su smra ba yin te /
translated: At the time of arising, the master teaches the subsequent speech for the purpose of clarifying suchness.

original: de kho na nyid rang byung yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de kho na nyid rang byung yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since suchness is self-originated,

original: de nyid bstan pa ni skyed par byed pa ma yin te skyon med pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa ni skyed par byed pa ma yin te skyon med pa yin no //
translated: teaching that suchness is not a creator is faultless.

original: rim pa lnga'i 'grel ba rim pa'i don gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba las rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa ste dang po'o /
analyzed: rim pa lnga'i 'grel ba rim pa'i don gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba las rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa ste dang po'o /
translated: This is the first stage of vajra repetition from the commentary on the five stages called Clarifying the Meaning of the Stages.

original: // / da ni rim pa gnyis pa rtsom pa'i dang por /
analyzed: // / da ni rim pa gnyis pa rtsom pa'i dang por /
translated: Now, in the beginning of the second stage,

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang la phyag 'tshal ba'i phyir /üîΩphyag 'tshal 'dud cing phyag 'tshal bdud //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang la phyag 'tshal ba'i phyir / phyag 'tshal 'dud cing phyag 'tshal bdud //
translated: In order to pay homage to the Bhagavat Vajradhara,üîΩhe says:üîΩHomage, obeisance, homage, homage to the demons!

original: phyag 'tshal bstod de phyag 'tshal 'dud //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal bstod de phyag 'tshal 'dud //
translated: Homage, praise, homage, obeisance!

original: ji ltar bstod cing phyag 'tshal ba //
analyzed: ji ltar bstod cing phyag 'tshal ba //
translated: How is there praise and homage?

original: gang la bstod cing gang gis bstod //
analyzed: gang la bstod cing gang gis bstod //
translated: To whom is there praise? By whom is there praise?

original: rdo rje 'chang chen khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to you, Great Vajradhara!

original: zhes rnam par snang mdzad chen po'i rang bzhin la phyag 'tshal ba'o //
analyzed: zhes rnam par snang mdzad chen po'i rang bzhin la phyag 'tshal ba'o //
translated: Thus, he pays homage to the nature of Great Vairocana.

analyzed: lhag ma phyag 'tshal ba ldas de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin gyi rdo rje 'chang chen po de nyid la phyag 'tshal ba bstan no //
translated: The remaining eleven homages teach homage to that very Great Vajradhara, whose nature is the five Tathagatas.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /üîΩji ltar bstod cing phyag 'tshal ba //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / ji ltar bstod cing phyag 'tshal ba //
translated: For that very reason,üîΩhe says, How is there praise and homage?

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te ji ltar btod pa las ma 'das te phyag 'tshal ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te ji ltar btod pa las ma 'das te phyag 'tshal ba'o //
translated: It is homage that does not transgress the praise.

original: ma 'das pa de nyid bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ma 'das pa de nyid bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that very non-transgression,

original: gang la bstod cing gang gis bstod //
analyzed: gang la bstod cing gang gis bstod //
translated: he says, To whom is there praise? By whom is there praise?

original: ces bya ba gsungs te rang nyid med pa'i chos sku la stod pa po dang / bstod par bya ba dang bstod pa rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te rang nyid med pa'i chos sku la stod pa po dang / bstod par bya ba dang bstod pa rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is stated because the one who praises, the praise, and the one to be praised are not observed in the Dharma Body, which is devoid of self.

original: dper na 'khor gsum rnam par dag bas sbyin pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'khor gsum rnam par dag bas sbyin pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like generosity, etc., which are purified of the three spheres.

original: phyag 'tshal bar bya ba dang phyag 'tshal bar byed pa tha mi dad pa gang yin pa de ni bla na med pa'i phyag 'tshal ba yin no //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal bar bya ba dang phyag 'tshal bar byed pa tha mi dad pa gang yin pa de ni bla na med pa'i phyag 'tshal ba yin no //

analyzed: @226a * // de gang gi phyir phyag 'tshal ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi rang bzhin thob pa'i phyir bya ba ste /

original: de nyid gal te dbye ba mi dmigs pas rtogs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de nyid gal te dbye ba mi dmigs pas rtogs par 'gyur na /

analyzed: de'i tshe lus dang ngag gi phyag 'tshal bas dgos pa med pa'o //

analyzed: don 'di nyid dpal gsang ba 'dus pa las gsungs te /

original: glegs bam klog pa de bzhin du //
analyzed: glegs bam klog pa de bzhin du //

original: dkyil 'khor bya ba ma yin te //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bya ba ma yin te //

original: rdor mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal min //
analyzed: rdor mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal min //

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: de ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i phyogs su bshad pa yin te /

analyzed: 'di dag thams cad ni 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad du 'gal ba ma yin te mthar thug pa'i don to //

analyzed: de la phyag 'tshal ba'am dam pa yin no zhes bstan to //

analyzed: gal te chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin gyis grub na de'i tshe bsgom par bya ci dgos she na /

analyzed: 'on kyang kun mkhyen ma thob par //
translated: However, until omniscience is attained,

original: de ni nye bar dmigs mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni nye bar dmigs mi 'gyur //
translated: it will not be perceived.

original: mun nag rab rib kyis khengs pa //
analyzed: mun nag rab rib kyis khengs pa //

analyzed: de ni nye bar dmigs mi 'gyur // zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid mngon du mi 'gyur te /

original: de'i rang bzhin mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin mi shes pa'i phyir ro //

original: dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the example,

original: mun nag rab rib ces bya ba @226b gsungs te /
analyzed: mun nag rab rib ces bya ba @226b gsungs te /
translated: it is said, ‚Äúlike darkness and blindness.‚Äù

original: ji ltar mun nag rab rib kyis khengs pa'i khang pa la khang bdag gi bka' drin gyis /
analyzed: ji ltar mun nag rab rib kyis khengs pa'i khang pa la khang bdag gi bka' drin gyis /
translated: Just as in a house filled with darkness and blindness, by the kindness of the master of the house,

original: kha cig mar me thogs nas khang pa de'i nang na gnas pa'i bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: kha cig mar me thogs nas khang pa de'i nang na gnas pa'i bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: some take up a lamp and see the pots, cloth, and so on that are in the house.

original: de bzhin du bla ma'i drin gyis mi gsal ba'i de kho na nyid gsal bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de bzhin du bla ma'i drin gyis mi gsal ba'i de kho na nyid gsal bar 'gyur bas /
translated: In the same way, by the kindness of the guru, reality, which is not clear, becomes clear.

original: des skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not produced by that.

original: bsgom par rigs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom par rigs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is suitable to meditate.

original: da ni sems la dmigs pa'i rim pa mdor bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni sems la dmigs pa'i rim pa mdor bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to briefly teach the stages of observing the mind,üîΩit is said,

original: stong nyid shin tu stong pa dang // gsum pa stong pa chen po dang // bzhi pa thams cad stong pa ni //
analyzed: stong nyid shin tu stong pa dang // gsum pa stong pa chen po dang // bzhi pa thams cad stong pa ni //
translated: and the fourth, universal emptiness.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bye brag go //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bye brag go //
translated: These are the distinctions of cause and effect.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: sems rnam par dben pa'i skabs 'di la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i dbye bas sems rnam pa gsum yin te /
analyzed: sems rnam par dben pa'i skabs 'di la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i dbye bas sems rnam pa gsum yin te /
translated: In this context of the mind being isolated, there are three types of mind, distinguished as the engaging consciousness, the afflicted mental consciousness, and the consciousness of the ground of all.

original: de la 'og nas bshad par 'gyur ba'i sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas rang bzhin shes nas 'khor dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa dang po dag par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de la 'og nas bshad par 'gyur ba'i sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas rang bzhin shes nas 'khor dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa dang po dag par 'gyur na /
translated: Among them, if the first consciousness, together with its retinue, is purified by the process of mantra and mudra that will be explained below,

original: de'i tshe stong nyid ni snang ba'i ye shes shar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe stong nyid ni snang ba'i ye shes shar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then at that time emptiness will arise as the wisdom of appearance.

original: de bzhin du 'khor dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa gnyis pa dag par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'khor dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa gnyis pa dag par 'gyur na /
translated: Similarly, if the second consciousness, together with its retinue, is purified,

original: de'i tshe shin tu stong pa ni snang ba mched pa'i ye shes shar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe shin tu stong pa ni snang ba mched pa'i ye shes shar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, the very empty is the pristine consciousness of the appearance of increase.

original: de bzhin du 'khor dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa gsum pa dag par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'khor dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa gsum pa dag par 'gyur na /
translated: Similarly, when the three consciousnesses with their retinues are purified,

original: de'i tshe stong pa chen po ni snang ba nye bar thob pa shar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe stong pa chen po ni snang ba nye bar thob pa shar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: at that time, the great empty is the appearance of the close approach.

original: gsum po 'di rnams mi dmigs pa'i dus su bzhi pa ni thams cad stong pa ste sems kyi 'od gsal ba 'char bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsum po 'di rnams mi dmigs pa'i dus su bzhi pa ni thams cad stong pa ste sems kyi 'od gsal ba 'char bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When these three are not observed, the fourth is the appearance of the clear light of the mind, the empty of everything.

original: 'di rnams kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bye brag la brten te snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bye brag la brten te snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: These also appear based on the distinctions of cause and result.

original: de la stong pa la sogs pa gsum po ni rgyu dang / 'od gsal ba 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de la stong pa la sogs pa gsum po ni rgyu dang / 'od gsal ba 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Among them, the three, the empty, and so on, are the cause, and the clear light is the result.

original: yang na stong pa ni shin tu stong pa'i rgyu dang shin tu stong pa ni 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: yang na stong pa ni shin tu stong pa'i rgyu dang shin tu stong pa ni 'bras bu ste /
translated: Again, the empty is the cause of the very empty, and the very empty is the result.

original: de ltar kun la shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar kun la shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that in the same way for all.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bye brag bstan pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel pa las 'byung bar bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bye brag bstan pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel pa las 'byung bar bshad pa yin te /
translated: In order to teach the distinctions of cause and effect, it is explained as dependent origination.

original: gang zhig rten cing 'brel pa las 'byung ba de nyid skye ba med pa ste stong pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig rten cing 'brel pa las 'byung ba de nyid skye ba med pa ste stong pa nyid yin no //
translated: Whatever is dependent origination is itself unborn, that is, empty.

original: de bas na snang ba la sogs pa de rnams stong pa la sogs par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na snang ba la sogs pa de rnams stong pa la sogs par brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, those appearances and so forth are described as empty and so forth.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bye brag de nyid med par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bye brag de nyid med par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to make that distinction of cause and effect non-existent,

original: shes rab thabs su sbyor ba @227a * //üîΩlas // rdzogs pa nye bar thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: shes rab thabs su sbyor ba @227a * // las // rdzogs pa nye bar thob par 'gyur //
translated: the union of wisdom and methodüîΩwill attain perfection.

original: rdzogs pa nye bar thob 'gyur nas //
analyzed: rdzogs pa nye bar thob 'gyur nas //
translated: Having attained perfection,

original: thams cad stong pa'i 'od gsal ba //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: thams cad stong pa'i 'od gsal ba // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: all is the clear light of emptiness.

original: dang po shes rab kyi ye shes skye ba dang / de nas gnyis pa thabs kyi ye shes dang po las lhag pa skye ba ste /
analyzed: dang po shes rab kyi ye shes skye ba dang / de nas gnyis pa thabs kyi ye shes dang po las lhag pa skye ba ste /
translated: First, the wisdom of wisdom arises, and then the second, the wisdom of method, arises superior to the first.

original: de gnyis ka sbyor ba las nye bar thob pa ni ye shes gsum pa rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gnyis ka sbyor ba las nye bar thob pa ni ye shes gsum pa rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: From the union of those two, the third wisdom, perfection, is attained.

original: de nas nye bar thob pa rdzogs nas thams cad stong pa'i 'od gsal ba ni ye shes bzhi pa 'og nas bshad par 'gyur ba'i sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas rnal 'byor pa la snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas nye bar thob pa rdzogs nas thams cad stong pa'i 'od gsal ba ni ye shes bzhi pa 'og nas bshad par 'gyur ba'i sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas rnal 'byor pa la snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, when the attainment of the threshold is complete, the clear light of universal emptiness is the fourth intuition, which will appear to the yogin by the process of mantra and seal explained below.

original: nye bar thob pa ni dang po 'char pa dang / 'od gsal ba phyi nas 'char ba'o zhes bla ma rnams la 'dri bar bya ba 'am bshad pa'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brang bar bya'o //
analyzed: nye bar thob pa ni dang po 'char pa dang / 'od gsal ba phyi nas 'char ba'o zhes bla ma rnams la 'dri bar bya ba 'am bshad pa'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brang bar bya'o //
translated: The attainment of the threshold is the first arising, and the clear light is the subsequent arising.

original: sbyang bar bya ba dang / sbyong bar byed pa dang / sbyangs pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyang bar bya ba dang / sbyong bar byed pa dang / sbyangs pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to show what is to be refined, the means of refining, and the result of refining,üîΩthe three consciousnesses are applied,

original: rgyu yi rim pa rnam dag dang // rnam shes gsum po sbyor ba dang // stong pa gsum ni mnyam sbyor bas //üîΩbla med go 'phang thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu yi rim pa rnam dag dang // rnam shes gsum po sbyor ba dang // stong pa gsum ni mnyam sbyor bas // bla med go 'phang thob par 'gyur //
translated: and the three emptinesses are united.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: By this process, the supreme state is attained.

original: rgyu ni ye shes gsum yin te /
analyzed: rgyu ni ye shes gsum yin te /
translated: The cause is the three intuitions.

original: de rnams kyi rim pa ni go rims te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi rim pa ni go rims te /
translated: Their process is their order.

original: de'i rnam dag ni de'i rang bzhin yongs su shes pas gsal bar 'gyur ba'i bla med go 'phang ni thams cad stong pa thob par 'gyur ba mya ngan du bya ba yin no zhes tshig gis 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam dag ni de'i rang bzhin yongs su shes pas gsal bar 'gyur ba'i bla med go 'phang ni thams cad stong pa thob par 'gyur ba mya ngan du bya ba yin no zhes tshig gis 'brel pa'o //
translated: Its purity is the unsurpassed state, which is the state of the complete understanding of its nature, and is the nirvana that is attained through the realization of universal emptiness.

original: rgyu gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of that?üîΩThe three consciousnesses are connected with the path.

original: rnam shes gsum po sbyor ba dang // zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa gsum po'i 'brel pas so //
analyzed: rnam shes gsum po sbyor ba dang // zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa gsum po'i 'brel pas so //
translated: The three consciousnesses of engagement and so on are connected with the path.

original: de gang gi phyir 'jug pa la sogs pa rnam par shes pa gsum po kho na khyad par gyi phun sum tshogs pa rdzogs pas snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin du rdzogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de gang gi phyir 'jug pa la sogs pa rnam par shes pa gsum po kho na khyad par gyi phun sum tshogs pa rdzogs pas snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin du rdzogs pa yin te /
translated: Because the three consciousnesses of engagement and so on are perfected by the excellence of their distinction, they are perfected as the nature of the wisdom of appearance and so on.

original: 'dir spang bya dang blang bya gang yang med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir spang bya dang blang bya gang yang med pa yin no //
translated: Here, there is nothing to be abandoned or adopted.

original: de yang gang gi phyir rang bzhin yongs su shes pa kho na byang chub yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang gang gi phyir rang bzhin yongs su shes pa kho na byang chub yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the complete understanding of the nature is enlightenment.

original: de nas stong pa gsum pa dang sbyor ba ni rang bzhin rnams kyis rang gi ngo bo mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas stong pa gsum pa dang sbyor ba ni rang bzhin rnams kyis rang gi ngo bo mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: Then, the application to the third emptiness is the non-apprehension of the nature of the natures.

original: stong pa nyid gang yin pa des bla na med pa'i go 'phang snang bar 'gyur ro zhes ngag gi don te //
analyzed: stong pa nyid gang yin pa des bla na med pa'i go 'phang snang bar 'gyur ro zhes ngag gi don te //
translated: The meaning of the verse is that the emptiness which is that non-apprehension of the nature of the natures is the appearance of the unsurpassed state.

original: 'khor ba dang bcas pa sbyang bya dang sbyong byed dag gis rnam pa gsum bstan pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: 'khor ba dang bcas pa sbyang bya dang sbyong byed dag gis rnam pa gsum bstan pa'i sgo nas /
translated: Having taught the three aspects of the object of purification and the means of purification,

original: rnam grangs bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam grangs bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to explain the enumeration,üîΩit is said:üîΩAppearance, emptiness, wisdom,

original: snang ba stong pa shes rab dang // sems @227b dang gzhan gyi dbang dag ste //
analyzed: snang ba stong pa shes rab dang // sems @227b dang gzhan gyi dbang dag ste //
translated: mind, and the other-dependent,

original: de yi rang bzhin 'phro gsal ba //
analyzed: de yi rang bzhin 'phro gsal ba //
translated: its nature, radiance,

original: da ni rab tu bshad par bya //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni rab tu bshad par bya // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: now I will explain them.

original: snang bar byed pas na snang ba ste /
analyzed: snang bar byed pas na snang ba ste /
translated: Appearance is that which appears.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang po dang / yid dga' ba nyid du snang bar gyur pas snang ba'i ye shes kyang snang ba'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang po dang / yid dga' ba nyid du snang bar gyur pas snang ba'i ye shes kyang snang ba'o //
translated: The first consciousness of engagement and the wisdom of appearance are appearance because they appear as the delight of the mind.

original: stong pa ni de nyid rang bzhin gyis rang bzhin stong pa dang mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa ni de nyid rang bzhin gyis rang bzhin stong pa dang mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Emptiness is because that very [mind] is empty of inherent nature by its very nature and is not observed.

original: shes rab ni de nyid khyad par gyi ye shes yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab ni de nyid khyad par gyi ye shes yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Wisdom is because that very [mind] is the special wisdom.

original: sems ni de nyid de yul thams cad rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems ni de nyid de yul thams cad rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Mind is because that very [mind] realizes all objects.

original: gzhan dbang ni rgyud dang rkyen las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dbang ni rgyud dang rkyen las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rdo rje'i ming zhes bya ba ni rdo rjes nye bar mtshon pa'i thabs kyi ye shes so //

original: snga ma bzhin du 'dir yang nyi ma la gnas pa'i thig le gnyis dang bcas pa'i dang po yi ge las dang po pas bsgoms na de la nyi ma'i 'od zer dang 'dra ba'i snang ba mched pa'i ye shes 'char ba yin no //

translated: As before, here also, if one meditates on the first syllable with two drops located on the sun, the knowledge of the spreading light, which is like the sun's rays, arises in that.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa gnas pa ni nyi ma dang zla bas mtshan pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi 'khor lo la gnas pa'i thig le gnyis kyis brgyan pa'i yi ge dang po las 'byung ba'i 'od zer gyis gnas pa'i rlung gi rang bzhin padma'i mgon po'i yi ges bkug
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa gnas pa ni nyi ma dang zla bas mtshan pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi 'khor lo la gnas pa'i thig le gnyis kyis brgyan pa'i yi ge dang po las 'byung ba'i 'od zer gyis gnas pa'i rlung gi rang bzhin padma'i mgon po'i yi ges bkug
translated: The stage of completion is the abiding of the two drops adorned with the sun and moon, which are the letters that arise from the first letter, which is located in the wheel of the realm of phenomena.üîΩThe winds that are the nature of the abiding winds are drawn in and placed by the letters of the lotus lord, and the afflicted mind consciousness together with its retinue is reversed.

original: cing bcug la 'khor dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa ldog par 'gyur bas nyi ma'i 'od zer 'dra ba'i snang ba mched pa'i phye shes 'char bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: ye shes gsum pa bshad par bya ba'i phyir / snang ba thob pa dag dang ni //

analyzed: nye bar thob pa de bzhin te //

original: yongs su grub pa nyid dang ni //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa nyid dang ni //

analyzed: ma rig pa ni nyid ces bya // stong pa chen po'i tshig gi ni //

analyzed: rnam grangs 'di dag rgyal bas gsungs //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /

translated: The term ‚Äúgreat emptiness‚Äù is a synonym for the characteristic of the reversal of the store-consciousness, and it was taught by the Victorious Ones, the Tathagatas.

original: de la snang pa thob pa ni zla ba dang nyi ma'i snang ba dag gang du mi dmigs pa de ni snang ba thob pa ste /
analyzed: de la snang pa thob pa ni zla ba dang nyi ma'i snang ba dag gang du mi dmigs pa de ni snang ba thob pa ste /

analyzed: shes rab dang thabs kyi ye shes nus pas /

analyzed: rgyal ba lta bu ste mi g-yo ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //

analyzed: de gnyis ka las 'og tu mtshan pa'i phyir nye bar thob pa'o //

original: yongs su grub pa shes pa ni ye shes gnyis nub pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa shes pa ni ye shes gnyis nub pa'o //

analyzed: snga ma dang ni rtag tu bral //

analyzed: de ni yongs su grub par bshad // ces bya ba 'byung ngo // ma rig pa ni nyid ces bya //

analyzed: zhes pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni ma rig pa ste /

analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa'i @229b ye shes la blta ba gang yin pa de yang ma rig pa'o //

analyzed: rang bzhin de rnams bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain those natures,üîΩThe moment of middling attachment,üîΩThe moment of distraction, delusion,üîΩSilence, discouragement,

analyzed: chags pa bar ma'i skad cig dang // brjes ngas pa dang 'khrul pa dang // mi smrar gyur dang skyo ba dang // le lo de bzhin the tshom ste //

original: ma rig skad cig bdun po ni //
analyzed: ma rig skad cig bdun po ni //

analyzed: rlung gi sgo nas 'byung ba min //
translated: And do not arise through the door of the vƒÅyu.

original: gang zhig snang ba thob pa ni //
analyzed: gang zhig snang ba thob pa ni //
translated: The attainment of appearance

original: yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: is the characteristic of complete perfection.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te rang bzhin bdun po 'di rnams ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa las 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te rang bzhin bdun po 'di rnams ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa las 'byung ba ste /
translated: These seven natures, whose characteristic is ignorance, arise from the fruitional consciousness.

original: phra mo'i rnal 'byor pas shes bya //
analyzed: phra mo'i rnal 'byor pas shes bya //
translated: They are to be known by the subtle yogi.

original: zhes pa ni ku sha'i rtse mo dang 'dra ba'i blo can gyis rang rig pa nyid du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni ku sha'i rtse mo dang 'dra ba'i blo can gyis rang rig pa nyid du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: This is to be realized by the wise as self-awareness, like the tip of a ku≈õa blade.

original: rang bzhin 'di rnams kyi rang bzhin yongs su shes pa'i dus su sngar bshad pa'i sa bon dang / thig le dang / rlung la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'di rnams kyi rang bzhin yongs su shes pa'i dus su sngar bshad pa'i sa bon dang / thig le dang / rlung la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: When the nature of these natures is fully known, the previously explained seeds, drops, winds, and so on are not observed.

analyzed: de bas na mtshams kyi snang ba dang 'dra ba'i snang ba nye bar thob pa 'di ni yongs su rdzogs par shes par bya'o //

analyzed: mtshan mo dang nyin mo'i dbye bas rang bzhin 'di rnams kyi grangs bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain the number of these natures by the division of night and day, it is said:

original: rang bzhin phra ba brgya dang ni //
analyzed: rang bzhin phra ba brgya dang ni //
translated: These very eighty-four

original: drug cu tham pa 'di dag nyid //üîΩrlung la zhon pa'i rgyu yis ni //
analyzed: drug cu tham pa 'di dag nyid // rlung la zhon pa'i rgyu yis ni //
translated: subtle naturesüîΩarise day and night

analyzed: nyin dang mtshan du 'byung ba yin // zhes bya ba gsungs te /

analyzed: shes rab dang / thabs dang / nye bar thob pa'i rang bzhin brgyad cu 'di rnams mtshan mo dang nyin mo'i dbye bas brgya drug cur 'gyur ro //
translated: These eighty natures of wisdom, method, and close-to-attainment become one hundred and sixty by the division of night and day.

original: phra ba ni mtshon par dka' ba'i phyir te gang gi tshe rang bzhin gang 'byung zhes mnyam par ma bzhag pa rnams kyis mtshon par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: phra ba ni mtshon par dka' ba'i phyir te gang gi tshe rang bzhin gang 'byung zhes mnyam par ma bzhag pa rnams kyis mtshon par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: They are subtle because they are difficult to perceive, for when any nature arises, they are not to be perceived by those who are not in equipoise.

original: mnyam par bzhag pa skyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis kyang mtshon par dka' ba ste rags pa la zhen pas lha'i rnam pa la chags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pa skyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis kyang mtshon par dka' ba ste rags pa la zhen pas lha'i rnam pa la chags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are also difficult to perceive by those in equipoise, by yogis in the stage of generation, because they are attached to the coarse and attached to the form of the deity.

original: 'di rnams rgyu gang gis 'byung ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di rnams rgyu gang gis 'byung ba yin zhe na /

original: rlung la zhon pa'i rgyu yis ni //
analyzed: rlung la zhon pa'i rgyu yis ni //
translated: By the cause of riding on the winds.

original: zhes bya ba la rlung la zhon pa ni rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la rlung la zhon pa ni rnam par shes pa ste /

original: de nyid rang bzhin rnams kyir gyu yin te rgyu de las so //
analyzed: de nyid rang bzhin rnams kyir gyu yin te rgyu de las so //
translated: That itself is the cause of the appearances of the natures, because of that cause.

original: gang gi phyir ji srid rlung gis rang bzhin mi rnyed na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ji srid rlung gis rang bzhin mi rnyed na /

analyzed: de srid rang bzhin gyi snang ba 'byung ba ma yin no //

original: 'od gsal ba'i skabs la ni rlung la zhon pa'i rnam par shes pa mi dmigs @230a * //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba'i skabs la ni rlung la zhon pa'i rnam par shes pa mi dmigs @230a * //
translated: In the context of clear light, the consciousness riding the wind is not observed,

original: pas de rnams 'byung ba dang / mi 'byung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: pas de rnams 'byung ba dang / mi 'byung ba yang ma yin te /

analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs gang gis 'dzin par dka' ba'i phyir de'i rang bzhin dag las 'das pa yin no //
translated: Because it is difficult to apprehend by any position of existence or nonexistence, it transcends those natures.

original: 'o na yul so sor snang bas nyin mo dang rang bzhin rnams 'char mod kyi /
analyzed: 'o na yul so sor snang bas nyin mo dang rang bzhin rnams 'char mod kyi /

original: mtshan mo ni dbang po dgag pas ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan mo ni dbang po dgag pas ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But how do they arise at night, because the sense organs are blocked?

analyzed: smras pa / 'dir ji srid rlung dang rang bzhin la gnas pa de srid rmi lam dang / sad pa'i gnas skabs la rang bzhin rnams 'byung ba yin te /
translated: Objection: As long as one abides in the wind and the nature, for that long the nature of dreams and the waking state occur.üîΩIn the dream state,

original: rmi lam gyi gnas skabs su ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi gnas skabs su ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la /
translated: the latent tendencies are deposited in the foundation consciousness.

original: bag chags zhugs pas de nyid las de rnams 'byung ba ste skyon gang yang med do //
analyzed: bag chags zhugs pas de nyid las de rnams 'byung ba ste skyon gang yang med do //
translated: Since they arise from that, there is no fault.

original: yang na dngos po rnams med kyang 'khrul pas de rnams so sor snang ste dper na rmi lam lta bu ste /üîΩde bzhin du sad pa'i gnas skabs la yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na dngos po rnams med kyang 'khrul pas de rnams so sor snang ste dper na rmi lam lta bu ste / de bzhin du sad pa'i gnas skabs la yang shes par bya'o //

original: phung po khams dang skye mched dbang sogs la //
analyzed: phung po khams dang skye mched dbang sogs la //
translated: In the same way, it should be understood that this is also the case in the waking state.

original: shes pa gnyis po de 'dir rab 'dus nas //
analyzed: shes pa gnyis po de 'dir rab 'dus nas //
translated: The two consciousnesses are fully gathered hereüîΩin the aggregates, constituents, sense spheres, faculties, and so on.

original: stong chen gyur pas gang zhig gnyid log pa //
analyzed: stong chen gyur pas gang zhig gnyid log pa //
translated: One who falls asleep in a great empty house

original: rlung gi shugs kyis rmi lam mthong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rlung gi shugs kyis rmi lam mthong bar 'gyur //

original: rmi lam sad par bye brag gzhan med par //
analyzed: rmi lam sad par bye brag gzhan med par //

original: kun du rtogs pas rmi lam 'bras 'dod la //
analyzed: kun du rtogs pas rmi lam 'bras 'dod la //
translated: Imagination desires the results of dreams.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: and so on.

original: rang bzhin rnams dus ci tsam du 'char ba yin no zhes bya ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhin rnams dus ci tsam du 'char ba yin no zhes bya ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach for how long the natures arise, he says:üîΩA moment, a second, a minute,

original: skad cig thang cig yud tsam dang // mig btsums de bzhin thal mo ste //
analyzed: skad cig thang cig yud tsam dang // mig btsums de bzhin thal mo ste //
translated: a blink, and likewise a snap of the fingers.

original: zhes bya ba mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the brief teaching.

original: de nyid rgyas par bshad pa ni /üîΩskad cig se gol gtogs par bshad //
analyzed: de nyid rgyas par bshad pa ni / skad cig se gol gtogs par bshad //
translated: The extensive explanation of that is:

original: thang cig yungs kar bskor ba tsam //
analyzed: thang cig yungs kar bskor ba tsam //
translated: A moment is explained as the time it takes to snap the fingers.üîΩA second is the time it takes to roll a mustard seed between the palms.

original: yud tsam dbugs ni 'byung ba tsam //üîΩmig btsums mig ni 'dzums pa'i bar //
analyzed: yud tsam dbugs ni 'byung ba tsam // mig btsums mig ni 'dzums pa'i bar //
translated: A minute is the time it takes to exhale.üîΩA blink is the time it takes to close the eyes.

original: thal mo lag gnyis rdeb pa ste //
analyzed: thal mo lag gnyis rdeb pa ste //
translated: A snap of the fingers is the time it takes to clap the hands.

original: skad cig la sogs pa mtshan nyid do //üîΩzhes bya ba la dus ji tsam gyis se gol gtogs pa'i sgra rdzogs pa de ni skad cig ma zhes bya ba'i dus yin no //
analyzed: skad cig la sogs pa mtshan nyid do // zhes bya ba la dus ji tsam gyis se gol gtogs pa'i sgra rdzogs pa de ni skad cig ma zhes bya ba'i dus yin no //
translated: This is the definition of a moment and so on.üîΩA moment is the time it takes to complete the sound of snapping the fingers.

analyzed: dus ji tsam gyis lag pa'i mthil la yungs kar bskor ba de ni thang cig go //
translated: A second is the time it takes to roll a mustard seed between the palms.

analyzed: dus ji tsam gyi mig btsums pa de ni mig btsums pa'o //

analyzed: dus ji tsam gyis lag pas lag pa la brdabs pa de ni thal mo yin no //

analyzed: dus de dag gi sgo nas rang bzhin 'char ba mtshon par bya'o //
translated: By these times, the nature should be illustrated.

translated: Otherwise, not knowing which is the nature of wisdom, method, and ignorance, and when it arises, the natures will be confused.

analyzed: de bas na gang gis gang mi snang bar bya'o zhes the tshom za bas nam yang 'od gsal ba la zhugs par mi 'gyur ro //

original: 'o na khyab par byed pa'i rnam par dag pa la kho bo cag brten nas /
analyzed: 'o na khyab par byed pa'i rnam par dag pa la kho bo cag brten nas /
translated: ‚ÄúWell then, we rely on the purity of the pervader.

original: yang na skad cig ma la sogs pa'i dus kyi bye brag la zhe na de skad ma zer cig / bslab pa'i dus su khyab byed kyi rnam par dag pa gzung par nus pa ma yin no //

translated: When one is trained, the pervading purity cannot be grasped in terms of the distinctions of time.

analyzed: gang zag ni dbang po rno ba de rnams la dus kyi bye brag dgos pa ma yin te 'di yang 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
translated: For those of sharp faculties, the distinctions of time are not necessary. This will be explained later.

original: rang bzhi med pa'i dngos po rnams la ye shes dang rnam par shes pa'i dbye ba 'di ji ltar yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhi med pa'i dngos po rnams la ye shes dang rnam par shes pa'i dbye ba 'di ji ltar yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the distinction of intuition and consciousness is in things that lack intrinsic reality, it is said:

original: rang rig tsam gyi ye shes ni //
analyzed: rang rig tsam gyi ye shes ni //
translated: The intuition that is mere self-awareness

original: nam mkha' lta bur mtshan nyid med //
analyzed: nam mkha' lta bur mtshan nyid med //
translated: is like space, without characteristics.

original: 'on kyang de yi dbye yod de //üîΩmtshan nyin mo mtshams dag gis //
analyzed: 'on kyang de yi dbye yod de // mtshan nyin mo mtshams dag gis //
translated: However, its distinctionüîΩis by means of the characteristics of day and night.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te 'dir ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te 'dir ni /
translated: Here,

original: rang las ma yin gzhan las min //
analyzed: rang las ma yin gzhan las min //
translated: not from itself, not from another,üîΩand so on.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rigs pas khams gsum rnam par dpyad na stong pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rigs pas khams gsum rnam par dpyad na stong pa kho na yin te /
translated: By this reasoning, when the three realms are analyzed, they are just empty.

original: 'on kyang rnal 'byor spyod pa'i dbu ma'i phyogs su rang rig tsam gyi ye shes phyi nang gi gzugs su snang ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rnal 'byor spyod pa'i dbu ma'i phyogs su rang rig tsam gyi ye shes phyi nang gi gzugs su snang ba yin no //
translated: However, in the YogƒÅcƒÅra-Madhyamaka position, there is a mere consciousness of self-awareness that appears as external and internal forms.üîΩIf so, what is the difference between this and the proponents of consciousness with aspects?

original: 'o na rnam pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa smra ba las khyad par gang yod ce na smras pa /
analyzed: 'o na rnam pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa smra ba las khyad par gang yod ce na smras pa /
translated: It is said:

original: nam mkha' lta bur mtshan nyid med //
analyzed: nam mkha' lta bur mtshan nyid med //
translated: Like space, it is without characteristics.

original: ces bya ba ni ye shes de yang mtshan nyid de skye ba la sogs pa skye /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni ye shes de yang mtshan nyid de skye ba la sogs pa skye /
translated: This wisdom is also without characteristics such as arising.

original: de dang bral ba ni skye ba dang 'jig pa la sogs pa bral ba ste dbu ma pa'i grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: de dang bral ba ni skye ba dang 'jig pa la sogs pa bral ba ste dbu ma pa'i grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: Being free from that means being free from arising, ceasing, and so forth, which is the tenet of the Madhyamaka.

original: 'dis ni rang rig pa ma yin pa lta bu ste rang rig pa'i gzugs ma grub pas brjod du med pa'i gnas skabs yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rang rig pa ma yin pa lta bu ste rang rig pa'i gzugs ma grub pas brjod du med pa'i gnas skabs yin no //
translated: This is like not being self-aware, because the form of self-awareness is not established, so it is the inexpressible state.

original: 'on kyang de yi dbye yod de //
analyzed: 'on kyang de yi dbye yod de //
translated: However, its divisions exist.

original: zhes bya ba la sog pa la kun rdzob tu mtshan mo la sogs pa'i bye brag gi de'i dbye ba mtshon par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sog pa la kun rdzob tu mtshan mo la sogs pa'i bye brag gi de'i dbye ba mtshon par bya ba yin te /
translated: Here, the divisions of that are to be indicated by the distinctions of night and so forth conventionally.

original: dper na chos kyis ku dang longs spyod dang / sprul pa'i sku so sor snang ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na chos kyis ku dang longs spyod dang / sprul pa'i sku so sor snang ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the Dharma Body, the Enjoyment Body, and the Transformation Body appear separately.üîΩIn order to explain those divisions,

original: dbye ba de rnams bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dbye ba de rnams bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: it is said:

original: snang dang snang ba mched pa dang // de bzhin snang ba nyer thob pa //
analyzed: snang dang snang ba mched pa dang // de bzhin snang ba nyer thob pa //
translated: Appearance, increase of appearance, and likewise, attainment of appearance,

original: sems ni rnam pa gsum bshad nas //
analyzed: sems ni rnam pa gsum bshad nas //
translated: having explained the three aspects of mind,

original: de yi sgrub pa brjod par bya //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de yi sgrub pa brjod par bya // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: its accomplishment should be stated.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa snang ba la sogs par bshad pa yin te /üîΩrang bzhin rtogs na de rnams nyid kho na @231a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa snang ba la sogs par bshad pa yin te / rang bzhin rtogs na de rnams nyid kho na @231a * //
translated: The consciousnesses, etc. that operate in worldly conventions are explained as appearance, etc.

original: snang ba'i ye shes la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba'i ye shes la sogs pa'o //
translated: When their nature is realized, they are the wisdom of appearance, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam pa gsum gyi sems gang yin pa de sgrub pa de'i bsgrub pa ni srid pa skye ba'i rim pa brjod par bya ba ni bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam pa gsum gyi sems gang yin pa de sgrub pa de'i bsgrub pa ni srid pa skye ba'i rim pa brjod par bya ba ni bshad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the accomplishment of that mind which has three aspects is its accomplishment. Its arising should be explained.

original: de nyid bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain just that,

original: rlung rnams stong pa'i gzugs kyis ni //
analyzed: rlung rnams stong pa'i gzugs kyis ni //
translated: the winds in the form of emptiness,

original: shes dang yang dag 'dres gyur nas //
analyzed: shes dang yang dag 'dres gyur nas //
translated: Having mixed with the consciousness,

original: dbang po'i lam nas byung nas ni //
analyzed: dbang po'i lam nas byung nas ni //
translated: it emerges through the path of the sense organ

original: yul rnams la ni dmigs par byed //üîΩces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: yul rnams la ni dmigs par byed // ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: and focuses on the objects.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i rlung ni sreg dang rtsol ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa de dang / shes pa ni srid pa par ma do'i rnam par shes pa 'am mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa 'dres par 'gyur ba ni shu kra la sogs pa'i sgo nas yongs su gyur pa'am /üîΩgyen du rgyu ba la sogs pa dang 'dres par gyur nas dbang po'i lam ni kha'i lam mam /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i rlung ni sreg dang rtsol ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa de dang / shes pa ni srid pa par ma do'i rnam par shes pa 'am mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa 'dres par 'gyur ba ni shu kra la sogs pa'i sgo nas yongs su gyur pa'am / gyen du rgyu ba la sogs pa dang 'dres par gyur nas dbang po'i lam ni kha'i lam mam /
translated: The wind that is empty of intrinsic nature, called ‚Äúthe fire-coinciding‚Äù and ‚Äúthe life-upholding,‚Äù and the consciousness, which is the consciousness of the intermediate existence or the eye consciousness, etc., mix through the path of the semen, etc., and transform.

original: mig la sogs pa'i lam nas 'byung ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i lam nas 'byung ste /
translated: Or, having mixed with the upward moving wind, etc., it emerges through the path of the sense organ, the path of the mouth or the eyes, etc.

original: yul rnams ni gzugs la sogs pa ste de la dmigs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yul rnams ni gzugs la sogs pa ste de la dmigs par byed pa'o //
translated: The objects are forms, etc., and it focuses on them.

original: de'i tshe na snang pa rnams 'char ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe na snang pa rnams 'char ba yin no //
translated: At that time, the appearances arise.

original: sems la 'byung ba rnams 'byung ba bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems la 'byung ba rnams 'byung ba bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain the arising of the elements in the mind, it is said:

original: gang tshe snang bar ldan gyur pa'i //
analyzed: gang tshe snang bar ldan gyur pa'i //
translated: When it is endowed with appearance,

original: rlung ni bzhon pa nyid gyur pa //
analyzed: rlung ni bzhon pa nyid gyur pa //
translated: The winds are the mounts.

original: de tshe rang bzhin de dag kun //
analyzed: de tshe rang bzhin de dag kun //
translated: At that time, all those natures

original: ma lus lus pa med par 'jug / ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ma lus lus pa med par 'jug / ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: enter without exception.

original: snang ba ni rnam pa gsum gyi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: snang ba ni rnam pa gsum gyi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The appearance is the consciousness of the three aspects.

original: de dang ldan pa'i rlung ni gang tshe bzhon pa nyid du gyur pa ni de'i bdag nyid du tha mi dad par gyur na /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i rlung ni gang tshe bzhon pa nyid du gyur pa ni de'i bdag nyid du tha mi dad par gyur na /
translated: The wind that possesses that, when it becomes the mount, when it becomes the nature of that without being different,

original: de'i tshe rlung gis bskul bas so sor nges pa'i yul la dmigs pa'i dbang gis rang bzhin de dag kun ni rnam par shes pa la sems las 'byung ba'i chos 'jug pa ni skye bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe rlung gis bskul bas so sor nges pa'i yul la dmigs pa'i dbang gis rang bzhin de dag kun ni rnam par shes pa la sems las 'byung ba'i chos 'jug pa ni skye bar byed pa yin no //
translated: at that time, since it is impelled by the wind, it is the power of the object of each ascertainment. The entry of the phenomena of mind and mental factors into consciousness is the generation.

original: rang bzhin de rnams ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin de rnams ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What are those natures?

original: ma lus lus pa med pa zhes bya ba ni ma lus ni rnam pa gsum kyi rnam par shes pa las 'byung ba dang / lus pa med pa ni gang zhig tha dad par 'byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: ma lus lus pa med pa zhes bya ba ni ma lus ni rnam pa gsum kyi rnam par shes pa las 'byung ba dang / lus pa med pa ni gang zhig tha dad par 'byung ba rnams so //
translated: Without exception means that they arise from the consciousness of the three aspects, and without remainder means that they arise separately.

original: gal te sems las 'byung ba rnams tha dad par 'byung na yang /
analyzed: gal te sems las 'byung ba rnams tha dad par 'byung na yang /
translated: If the mental factors arise separately,

original: 'on kyang gtso bo dang yon tan gyi sgo nas ma lus pa nyams su myong ba ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang gtso bo dang yon tan gyi sgo nas ma lus pa nyams su myong ba ste /
translated: nevertheless, they are all experienced through the primary mind and the qualities.

original: dper na 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin 'byung ba'i tshe gti mug gi rang bzhin cha gcig tu 'char ba yin te chags pa dang ldan pa ni rmongs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin 'byung ba'i tshe gti mug gi rang bzhin cha gcig tu 'char ba yin te chags pa dang ldan pa ni rmongs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, when the nature of desire arises, the nature of delusion arises as a part of it, because one who is attached is deluded.

original: de ltar gzhan du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gzhan du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied in the same way to the others.üîΩIn order to explain from which one which nature arises,

original: gang las gang rang bzhin 'byung ngo zhes bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang las gang rang bzhin 'byung ngo zhes bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: it is said:

original: rlung @231b ni gang dang gar gnas par //
analyzed: rlung @231b ni gang dang gar gnas par //
translated: Wherever the wind abides,

original: rang bzhin de dang de 'byung 'gyur //
analyzed: rang bzhin de dang de 'byung 'gyur //
translated: that nature arises there.üîΩAs long as the wind does not move

original: ji srid rlung ni mi rgyu dang // snang ba mi g-yo bar gyur pa //
analyzed: ji srid rlung ni mi rgyu dang // snang ba mi g-yo bar gyur pa //
translated: and appearances do not move,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te gang dang gang zhes pa ni g-yon dang g-yas dang rtsa dbus ma rnams la rlung gnas pas rang bzhin de dang de zhes pa ni shes rab dang thabs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te gang dang gang zhes pa ni g-yon dang g-yas dang rtsa dbus ma rnams la rlung gnas pas rang bzhin de dang de zhes pa ni shes rab dang thabs te /
translated: The whatever refers to the left, right, and central channels, since the winds abide in them. The that refers to wisdom and method.

original: nye bar thob pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin 'byung ba ni skye bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: nye bar thob pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin 'byung ba ni skye bar byed pa yin no //
translated: The nature of the attainment is the arising, the generation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: ji sred rlung ni 'byung bar mi 'gyur na /üîΩde srid snang ba mi g-yo bar gyur pa //
analyzed: ji sred rlung ni 'byung bar mi 'gyur na / de srid snang ba mi g-yo bar gyur pa //
translated: as long as the wind does not arise,üîΩthe appearance does not move.

original: zhes pa ni rang bzhin gyi snang ba mi g-yo bar gyur pa ma yin te brtan par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rang bzhin gyi snang ba mi g-yo bar gyur pa ma yin te brtan par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The nature of the appearance does not move, it does not become stable.

original: 'dir ni bkag pa'i sgra bya rog gi mig bzhin du tshig rkang gnyis dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni bkag pa'i sgra bya rog gi mig bzhin du tshig rkang gnyis dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Here the negative particle is to be connected with the two lines like the crow's egg,

original: snang ba rnams kyi rang bzhin bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: snang ba rnams kyi rang bzhin bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain the nature of the appearances,üîΩthe root text says:

original: snang ba gnyis ni rgyur gyur pas //
analyzed: snang ba gnyis ni rgyur gyur pas //
translated: The two appearances are imaginedüîΩto be the entity of the self,

original: bdag gi dngos por rnam par brtag / ji ltar snang ba thob pa ltar //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos por rnam par brtag / ji ltar snang ba thob pa ltar //
translated: in accordance with the attainment of the appearances.

original: gnyis ka'i yan lag nyid du 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gnyis ka'i yan lag nyid du 'gyur // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is the limb of both.

original: sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pa gnyis las gang yang rung ba'i thabs kyis dang po snang ba gnyis ni zla ba dang / nyi ma'i 'od zer dang 'dra bar 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pa gnyis las gang yang rung ba'i thabs kyis dang po snang ba gnyis ni zla ba dang / nyi ma'i 'od zer dang 'dra bar 'byung ba yin te /
translated: From the two stages of mantra and seal, by the method of either one, the first appearance arises like the light rays of the moon and sun.

original: de nyid rgyu gang la yod pa de ni //
analyzed: de nyid rgyu gang la yod pa de ni //
translated: That which has that cause isüîΩimagined as the entity of the self.

original: bdag gi dngos por rnam par brtag / ces pa ni snang ba nye bar thob par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos por rnam par brtag / ces pa ni snang ba nye bar thob par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The appearance that is attained arises.

original: gang zhig snang ba thob pa gsum pa 'di nyid /
analyzed: gang zhig snang ba thob pa gsum pa 'di nyid /
translated: This third attainment of appearance

original: gnyis ka'i yan lag nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i yan lag nyid du 'gyur //
translated: is the limb of both.

original: zhes pa ni ye shes gnyis kyi cha dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni ye shes gnyis kyi cha dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is endowed with the aspect of both exalted wisdoms.

original: gang gi phyir shes rab dang thabs kyi ye shes gnyis dang 'dres pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir shes rab dang thabs kyi ye shes gnyis dang 'dres pa ste /
translated: Because it is mixed with the two exalted wisdoms of wisdom and method,

original: mi dang seng ge bzhin du dngos po gzhan gnyis ka'i cha rags pa nub pa /
analyzed: mi dang seng ge bzhin du dngos po gzhan gnyis ka'i cha rags pa nub pa /
translated: like a human and a lion, the coarse aspect of both is submerged.

original: dga' pa gnyis dang bral ba dang / brgyal ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: dga' pa gnyis dang bral ba dang / brgyal ba lta bu ste /
translated: Free from the two joys, it is like fainting.

original: sa'i phyogs gcig las 'dres par 'gyur ba'i chu bo'i rgyun gnyis lta bu'o //
analyzed: sa'i phyogs gcig las 'dres par 'gyur ba'i chu bo'i rgyun gnyis lta bu'o //
translated: Like the two streams of a river that merge in one place on the earth.üîΩNow, in order to explain the purification of the mind by the stage of the seal,

original: da ni phyag rgya'i rim pas sems rnam par dag pa bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni phyag rgya'i rim pas sems rnam par dag pa bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: it is said:

original: sgyu ma dag ni thams cad las //
analyzed: sgyu ma dag ni thams cad las //
translated: Among all the illusions,

original: bud med sgyu ma khyad par 'phags //
analyzed: bud med sgyu ma khyad par 'phags //
translated: the illusion of a woman is supreme.

original: ye shes gsum gyi dbye ba ni //
analyzed: ye shes gsum gyi dbye ba ni //
translated: The division of the three intuitions

original: gsal bar 'di las mtshon par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gsal bar 'di las mtshon par 'gyur // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: is clearly indicated by this.

original: re zhig sngar bshad pa'i sngags kyi rim pas ye shes gsum gyi dbye ba mtshon par 'gyur te /
analyzed: re zhig sngar bshad pa'i sngags kyi rim pas ye shes gsum gyi dbye ba mtshon par 'gyur te /
translated: The division of the three intuitions is indicated by the mantra stage explained above.

original: 'on kyang 'dod chags kyi rigs can la ltos te phyag rgya'i rim pas kyang de nyid mtshon par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dod chags kyi rigs can la ltos te phyag rgya'i rim pas kyang de nyid mtshon par bya'o //
translated: However, in terms of the lustful, that is indicated by the stage of the seal.

original: de la sgyu ma thams cad ni rdzu 'phrul mkhan la sogs pas byas pa'i sgyu ma ste de rnams @232a * //
analyzed: de la sgyu ma thams cad ni rdzu 'phrul mkhan la sogs pas byas pa'i sgyu ma ste de rnams @232a * //
translated: There, all illusions are the illusions created by magicians, etc.

original: kyi nang nas bud med sgyu ma khyad par 'phags //
analyzed: kyi nang nas bud med sgyu ma khyad par 'phags //
translated: Among them, the illusion of a woman is supreme.

original: zhes pa ni khyad par gyi gnas skabs dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes pa ni khyad par gyi gnas skabs dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: This has the state of distinction.

original: de gang gi phyir snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes gsum gyi dbye ba'i khyad par gsal bar shes pa ni the tshom med pas bud med sgyu ma 'di nyid las mtshon par 'gyur pa ni thob pa nyid du gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de gang gi phyir snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes gsum gyi dbye ba'i khyad par gsal bar shes pa ni the tshom med pas bud med sgyu ma 'di nyid las mtshon par 'gyur pa ni thob pa nyid du gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of that, the clear knowledge of the distinctions of the three wisdoms of appearance and so forth is without doubt.  This illusory woman herself is the attainment of the sign, because she is the very attainment.

original: ma thob pa thob pa ma yin pas dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma thob pa thob pa ma yin pas dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since there is no attainment of what has not been attained, she is the object.

original: 'dir ni man ngag yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni man ngag yin te /
translated: Here there is an esoteric instruction.

original: shes rab kyi dbang gi dus su bla mas shes rab sbyin pa'i slob ma la bstan pa la sogs pa'i yan lag bzhi'i rim pas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi dbang gi dus su bla mas shes rab sbyin pa'i slob ma la bstan pa la sogs pa'i yan lag bzhi'i rim pas /
translated: At the time of the wisdom initiation, the guru teaches the disciple who is giving the wisdom consort the four branches of the rite of the introduction.

original: dang po tshangs pa'i bu ga las byang chub kyi sems 'dzag na /
analyzed: dang po tshangs pa'i bu ga las byang chub kyi sems 'dzag na /
translated: First, if the bodhicitta drips from the aperture of BrahmƒÅ,

original: de'i tshe 'khor dang bcas pa'i 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa mi dmigs pas rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / dmigs pa med pa ste zla ba'i 'od zer bzhin du dri ma med pa /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'khor dang bcas pa'i 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa mi dmigs pas rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / dmigs pa med pa ste zla ba'i 'od zer bzhin du dri ma med pa /
translated: at that time, since the entering consciousness together with its retinue is not observed, it is nonconceptual and objectless, stainless like the light of the moon.

original: snang ba'i ye shes kyi skad cig ma 'char bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snang ba'i ye shes kyi skad cig ma 'char bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The moment of the wisdom of appearance arises.

original: de'i rjes la byang chub kyi sems des yan lag thams cad kyi tshigs khyab pa'i dus su 'khor dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa mi dmigs pas /
analyzed: de'i rjes la byang chub kyi sems des yan lag thams cad kyi tshigs khyab pa'i dus su 'khor dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa mi dmigs pas /
translated: After that, when the bodhicitta pervades all the joints, the afflicted mental consciousness together with its retinue is not observed.

original: nyi ma'i 'od zer dang 'dra ba'i snang ba mched pa'i ye shes gnyis pa 'char bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyi ma'i 'od zer dang 'dra ba'i snang ba mched pa'i ye shes gnyis pa 'char bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The second pristine consciousness of the appearance of the light rays of the sun arises.

original: de'i rjes la yang rdo rje'i dbu ma'i rtse mor byang chub kyi sems des khyab na /
analyzed: de'i rjes la yang rdo rje'i dbu ma'i rtse mor byang chub kyi sems des khyab na /
translated: After that, when the bodhicitta pervades the tip of the vajra,

original: de'i tshe rang bzhin dang bcas pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa mi dmigs pas /

analyzed: des na de la gzhi mthun pa'i bsdu ba bya'o //

translated: The story that is told in that text is that when the BhagavƒÅn ≈öƒÅkyamuni was going to the place of awakening in the midst of his retinue, he thought, ‚ÄúThe state of great emptiness alone is awakening,‚Äù and he went to the bank of the Naira√±janƒÅ River and sat in the immovable meditative concentration.
